content:
That's great to hear! Focusing on shorebirds can be a wonderful way to challenge yourself and improve your identification skills. With your preparation and knowledge of the different species and their habitats, you'll be well-equipped to spot some exciting birds during your trip.

Remember to take your time, observe the birds carefully, and note their behavior, plumage, and size. Don't hesitate to ask for help or guidance from more experienced birders if you're unsure about an identification.

Additionally, consider keeping a journal or log of your sightings, including notes and sketches of the birds you see. This can help you track your progress, remember specific details about each species, and reflect on your experiences.

Most importantly, have fun and enjoy the thrill of the hunt! Shorebirds can be quite fascinating, and the thrill of spotting a new species can be exhilarating.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I wish you a wonderful trip and happy birding!
